I'd be Zora Neale Hurston's “But their eyes darted to god.” This is the story of Janie Crawford, sold by her grandmother to a man who owns 60 acres of land. Her curiosity and determination enable her to discover life, its joys and sorrows, but also love. This book is a magnificent feminist work.

Redemption Song tells the story of Bob Marley's escape from a cycle of persecution with the help of God. He then speaks to his fans: “Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery, no one but ourselves can free our spirit”. The song is like his farewell message.
